"Would you like to join me?" asked the attractive blond German. Lari tried not to beam her surprise at being invited to have coffee with someone so gorgeous. She had always had a thing for Germans.

They chatted for awhile. Finally she asked, "So what would you do if you found you only had six months to live?"

He looked thoughtful, and sipped his cappucino. "I would say to hell with the world, and do everything I always wanted to do."

"Like what?"

"Have lots of sex, without care of STDs, drink, smoke, travel..."

"I have six months to live," blurted out Lari. "I have brain cancer, and I don't want to get it treated."

He gazed at her a moment, apparently not surprised. "Want to have some fun?" he asked finally. "I've got money, lots of it, and I don't really care what happens to me."
1321.title: Johann

13211.content:
Johann explained to Lari that he had very rich parents, and was currently living on a stipend in the United States. A very large stipend. Basically, he was rich and bored. He was only 25, and had already traveled around the world, experiencing everything his money could buy him. He was also lonely, because he had started despising other rich people. He wanted to meet average people, but he was scared of meeting someone who just wanted him for his money. Lari, however, had an intensity and franticness about her that attracted Johann. He didn't know if she was telling the truth about having six months to live or not, but he could find out.

"So what have you always wanted to do?" he asked.

"Everything," she said simply, "I've done nothing with my life. I went to college, I work, I have never had enough money to have fun - to learn to dance, to travel, to SCUBA dive, to dive from a plane, bungi jump, swim with sharks...!"

"OK, OK," said Johann, and finished off his coffee, "Let's get started. First, you need some supplies, and new clothes. We're going to the South Pacific. You can do all those things there."

In a few hours, Lari made a phone call to her mother from the airport. "I'm mailing you the keys to my apartment and my car," said Lari, "And a few other things you might find useful in getting rid of my stuff and my apartment, including cash. I'll see you in a few months." Before her mother could ask, Lari hung up the phone. Johann put his arm around her, and they walked to the gate. She smiled as she looked at her ticket - a one way ticket to Bangkok.
13211.title: Expedition

13212.content:
"Do you like boats?" asked Johann, "I was thinking of buying a boat. Let's got to ze boat store. Of course, you do realize that ze boat store is in San Diego?"

"What are we waiting for?" asked Lari, "I just want to have fun at this point."

"Hmm," grunted Johann, "It seems like I never have any fun anymore. Friends, women, everyone, who can the rich trust? I don't even know if I can trust you. But you don't look like a gold digger. There's something, I don't know, desperate and without hope in you. I'm intrigued." He looked deep into her eyes, as if hoping to read the story of her life in them. Finally she broke the gaze.

"What do you want to know? You probably have the money to hire a private detective and do a complete background check on me. You're welcome to it. I'm nothing, nothing but an average college graduate, living in no-where's-ville America. But what about you... you could be a pervert, a liar, a scam artist. If you are, do your worst, I've got no money, and I am ... hopeless."

Johann smiled. "At least you're interesting! So you're willing to hop a plane with me today, now, this minute?"

"Absolutely," said Lari firmly.
13212.title: A boat

132122.content:
Despite Lari's best effort to get out of town without a backwards glance, she couldn't help but sneak a phone call while Johann was arranging the flight with the pilot of his private jet. She slipped into the phone booth and dialed the number.

"Tori? It's Lari. You won't believe what a day I've had."

"Lari, Oh my god I was just going to call you! Guess who's going on tour? The Goatsbeard Band! Tickets go on sale in the morning, so we have to camp out-"

"Tori!" Lari interrupted. She knew she shouldn't have called her self involved neighbor, but Tori was the only one who had a spare key to Lari's apartment. "Tori, I'm going out of town for awhile. You have to call my mom, and let her into my apartment. I'll try to send money to get out of my lease, but this is very important, she needs to move my stuff out of my apartment. Get a pen, here's her number. Oh! And you have to feed Demeter!"

A few moments later, Lari looked out of the phone booth and saw Johann looking around the terminal for her. She quickly got rid of Tori by saying that she had met a rich man who had swept her off her feet and didn't have time to talk. Tori seemed to understand immediately, she always acted like she knew exactly what people meant when it came to matters of the heart, as if she had done and experienced it all.

When Johann turned away, Lari ran up to him breathlessly, and explained that she had been in the restroom.

"Hmm, yeah, well, Orlando says we can get on the runway in 15 minutes. Do you need anything before we go? Dramamine, valium, whiskey?"

Suddenly, Lari realized that she hated flying. She never had claustrophobia on the ground, but as soon as she was locked into that tiny cabin with no chance of escape, she freaked.

"What is that green color in your face?" asked Johann, "Ohhh, you don't like flying!" He laughed as if this was the funniest thing he had ever heard. "Don't worry, you won't even know you are flying on my plane. We have many diversions on it," he said conspiratorially, putting his arm reassuringly around her waist, and leading her through the airport.

As she stepped onto the plane, she understood what Johann meant. The plane looked like a low-ceilinged living room, with tasteful leather chairs scattered about, a big screen television nook, a full bar, and even a computer. Johann went directly to the television nook and threw himself casually onto the low couch. A woman suddenly brushed around Lari and went to the bar. "Your usual, Mr. Brehm?"

"Yes, Kelly, and make the same for my new friend, the very airplane scared Ms.... what is your last name, Lari?"

Lari settled herself on the couch by Johann and guzzled her whiskey. She immediately felt better. "You can call me Ms. Scarlet, Kelly."

Johann put his arms around her and whispered, "No fear, the flight will be over in no time. Until then, Kelly will you excuse us for the rest of the flight?"
132122.title: Scared of planes

1321221.content:
Johann successfully managed to keep Lari's mind off the fact that she was terrified of flying. The four-hour flight to San Diego seemed to take no time at all, as Johann's skillful lovemaking delighted and pleasured Lari the entire flight. When Lari finally claimed exhaustion, the pilot's voice came over the intercom, "We will be landing in just a few minutes, Mr. Brehm."

They took a taxi to the "boat store," as Johann called it. It was actually a show room in downtown San Diego, with only a few actual sailboats for them to explore. Johann immediately went into negotiations with the salesman, while Lari explored the boats.

"What if I want to hire a crew to help me sail and buy one of these tubs of yours, and leave immediately?" she heard him say as she ducked into the cabin of the 30 foot show room sailboat. She loved the close, comfortable feeling of the little cabin, with everything reduced in size, and space so efficiently utilized. She could picture herself spending the rest of her life in this little compartment. And suddenly, that was what she wanted most. But then she heard sounds of yelling from the show room.

"Come on Lari, we are leaving! This schweinhund can keep his lousy tubs!"

"Mr. Brehm, please," wheedled the salesman, "You're asking too much. I just don't think you can get a crew in only a day. Now we can get you the finest boat in stock by tomorrow, but the crew is another thing entirely!"

"Pull some strings, Herr Carlson," said Johann, leaning close to the salesman, "I expect to be interviewing for crew positions on my new boat tomorrow afternoon. I will have my personal assistant bring you the money, and you may tell him where I may find my boat tomorrow."

They left, sweeping out of the "boat store" imperiously, with the salesman gaping behind. "Things always fall into place, don't worry, I've done these things before," said Johann.

They got back into the cab, with Johann saying, "Where would you like to stay tonight, liebe? I've never been to San Diego, cab driver, take us to San Diego's finest hotel."
1321221.title: The Boat Store

1322.content:
"My name is Thor," he said, "You look... nervous. Is everything all right?"

"No," she said, sitting down and leaning across the table, "I'm thinking of causing some trouble."

"Oh, I've caused some trouble in my life. Need any advise?"

"What would you do if you only had six months to live?" she asked.

He looked thoughtful. "Well, I'd probably do something I've always wanted to do, and then try to get myself cured. In fact, my wife would probably take me directly to the hospital and check me in, kicking and screaming."

Lari shot him a hurt look. "I thought you were hitting on me," she said defensively.

"Did you want someone to hit on you?" he asked. "Or maybe you just need to get laid."

"Look, I didn't come here to get insulted," said Lari, standing up.

"No, that came out wrong, please sit," said Thor, "what I meant to say was maybe you need to meet some people, maybe you're just lonely and need some compassion. Sex is just the easiest, fastest way to get satisfaction."

Lari nodded. "You're right. I'm just screwed up. Thanks for the talk."

As she walked away, Thor suddenly grabbed her arm. "I have an idea," he said.
1322.title: Thor

13221.content:
"You should meet my wife," he says. When you roll your eyes and look like you are going to say something snotty, he quickly interjects, "no, she's really cool. She paints portraits, and if what you say is true, about only having six months to live, I think you should have your portrait painted."

Lari was surprised. She hadn't expected THAT. She found herself saying...
13221.title: Portraitist

132212.content:
"That really does sound fitting..."

Suddenly, Lari saw someone she knew sitting at a table behind Thor. He saw her looking at him, and quickly dropped his gaze. It was...
132212.title: Change of Plans

choices: Take a ride on his motorcycle
1322121.content:
It was Trent, a former co-worker from the restaurant she used to wait tables at. He worked the bar at the restaurant, and as far as she knew, he still worked there. She hadn't seen him in over a year, but they used to flirt with each other shamelessly. Unfortunately, he had a girlfriend at the time, and so they never went out.

Lari remembered she was supposed to be talking to Thor, and she said, "I see someone I know. Maybe I'll do the portrait thing some other time. Nice meeting you." With that, she brushed past Thor and walked over to Trent's table.

"Long time no see, Trent, are you waiting for someone?"

Trent looked up at her, and beamed a smile that lit up Lari's world. "Yeah," he said, "I've been waiting for you."

Lari sat down, smirking at his joke. Same old Trent. "So how's that girlfriend of yours?"

"What girlfriend?"

"Did you break up with what's her name, Tiffany?"

"She dumped me. For a rich guy. Who can blame her really. But let's not talk about her, what have you been up to?"

Lari decided not to mention the brain cancer thing. Too much of a conversation drain. "Let's just say I've got a new perspective on life. Live for the moment, who knows when the ax could drop, right?"

"Carpe diem," said Trent, "So what are we doing here? Let's go sieze the day."

Lari leaned across the table intently. "Let's start at your place."
1322121.title: Carpe Diem

13221211.content:
"I thought you'd never ask," said Trent.

As they left the restaurant, Lari said, "I've always wondered why we never hooked up, Trent."

"Well, for starters, we were co-workers. You know how everyone at Yvette's gossipped."

"Oh, everyone at Yvette's was fucking around with each other. Do you still work there?"

"Yeah, they made me bar manager."

Lari laughed as she got into Trent's car. "Looks like you got a raise, you used to just ride your bike to work."

When they got to Trent's apartment, he offered her a beer. "I don't normally drink this early in the day, but what the hell. Here's to life," she toasted, raising her bottle to Trent's.

They sat on the couch for awhile, reminiscing about their years spent at the restraurant, talking about former co-workers and customers. Finally, Trent leaned close, and they kissed passionately. Their clothes seemed to melt off their bodies, and Trent proved to be an incredible lover.

Afterwards, as Lari lay in Trent's arms, she said, "I want to blow up some dams."
13221211.title: Lovers

choices: Lari is being watched at the library
Lari finds something interesting on the internet
132212111.content:
"I'm confused," said Trent, "am I such a fabulous lover that I inspire you to wreak havoc around the world, or have you lost your mind."

"I haven't lost my mind yet," said Lari, "But we'll see how things are in a few months. No, I've been reading about these eco-terrorists in my environmental magazines, and it just makes sense, you know?"

She disengaged herself from his arms, and walked over to the refrigerator, oblivious to her nakedness. "Capitalism encourages the destruction of natural resources, and individuals are powerless to stop it. The only choice we have is outright property destruction."

"But don't you think that's bad public relations for the environmental cause? Don't you want to get people on your side, pass laws, encourage grass roots change?"

"So you've thought about this too?" asked Lari, surprised that Trent had an intellectual side.

"Well, yeah," he said, embracing her from behind, "I'm a nature boy at heart."

Lari offered him the bottle of water she had been drinking from, and said, "I think there are a lot of people out there who want to see dams blown up and suburbs burned to the ground. I think it's good P.R."

"Has this ever been successfully accomplished before? Can two people working alone really blow up a hydro electric dam?"

"You're right, we need a plan. And we need to research. I'm not going to waste my time on something doing it in a half-assed way. Let's got the library."

For the next three weeks, Lari and Trent spent their time researching and making love. Trent continued working at the restaurant to support them, and Lari ended up moving in with him. Then one day...
132212111.title: Discussion

13222.content:
"I think you will like my friends," said Thor as they drove through a light early evening rain, "They're activists, and always looking for someone with new ideas. You can help each other."

Lari tried not to be distracted by Thor's piercing blue eyes, the light blond stubble covering his chin, and the bit of tattoo visible on his upper arm. She stared out the window.

"Do you ever get tired of knowing you have to sleep with the same woman for the rest of your life?" She asked.

"No," he said, "we have a pact."

"Oh?"

"If I sleep with someone, then she gets to sleep with someone. Unfortunately, I've used my "free fuck" card and she still hasn't. Trust me, I would have you pressed up against the wall of that coffee shop bathroom right now if it weren't for that. Besides, you're at a strange time in your life. You need friends, and something to keep your mind occupied."

They pulled up in front of a warehouse in an ugly part of town. The hallway smelled of cat urine. The sounds of music and laughter at the top of the stairs however seemed promising. Looking up, Lari saw someone leaning over the railing. He called out in a booming voice "Thor! Who have you brought us?"

"Her name is Lari, Lari this is Louis." They shook hands, Louis's eyes wandering freely and appreciatively over Lari's body.

"And what brings you to us, Lari?"

"I want to blow some shit up," she said, "And bring down capitalism."
13222.title: purpose

132221.content:
"Is she cool?" Louis asked Thor.

"I think so. I don't know, I just met her at the coffee shop. She had that desperate trapped look, so of course I found her irresistable." His eyes twinkled at Lari. She smiled in spite of herself, trying to hate him, but unable to. He was just so NICE.

"Put your arms up," said Louis, "I'm going to frisk you for bugs, cell phones, whatever. You a cop?" he asked casually as his hands patted her down in a most unprofessional manner.

"No," said Lari, "Are you just trying to score a quick grope?"

"Yes, but it's for a legitimate purpose." He stood up and looked Lari in the eye. "There are plenty of folks out there who would love to know where we've currently set up camp. We've moved three times in the past year. We're paranoid, but that doesn't mean they're not out to get us. No, you're not a cop, you're just a kid. And you do have that desperate panic look. Come on in," at this he opened the door, "Do you want some food?"

Lari stood for a moment surveying the scene. It was a huge room, probably formerly a production or assembly line in a past life. Now it was a maze of people bustling around like ants. A row of four or five computers stood against the wall to her left. Maps covered the walls everywhere. It seemed like people were working very hard on... something. There didn't seem to be enough desks for everyone, so they were working standing up, sitting on the floor, and crowded around tables. As they walked to the back of the room, Thor put his arm around Lari's waist.

"I'll see you around," he said, and he kissed her softly and quickly on the mouth,"you'll be fine."

She watched him walk away, suddenly aware that he was probably her ideal man, perfect in every detail but one - he was married. Forcing herself to be strong, to focus on the matter at hand, she turned to Louis. He smiled. "I can help you forget about him if you want," he said playfully.

"And I think I know how you can do that," said Lari. "Tell me the plan."
132221.title: inside

1322211.content:
"You want to get right down to work," he said, "I can respect that."

He walked briskly to a door at the far end of the room. Lari followed him inside. Books were scattered everywhere in here as well, but there were no people. "This is my office. This is where I interrogate people."

Lari looked him calmly in the eye and said,"I don't have time for games. What can I do?"

He smiled and sat on the table with his arms folded across his chest. "As you probably guessed, this is not our secret headquarters. These people all have regular jobs or they're students. They are not criminals. They donate their time researching, writing letters, analyzing data and crunching numbers. It's all legit. They might vaguely know what some of us are up to, and they tacitly agree. But they don't want to do jail time.

"Then there's the rest of us. A small but dedicated core of environmentalists with a vision for the future that is not exactly... mainstream. If you had found your way here through any means other than Thor, I'd have given you an entirely different speech, and sent you to work writing a letter to your Congressperson."

"Who is Thor?"

"He's an artist." Something about his facial expression seemed odd to Lari. The slight smirk about his mouth perhaps.

"He's my "in" isn't he?" she asked.

"He seems to trust you," said Louis, jumping up and pacing the floor, "he used the password, but never mind that, the point is this - we need more people on the inside. People with nothing to lose. People with vision. What's your vision, Lari?"
1322211.title: What's your vision?

13222111.content:
Lari looked around for a chair. Not seeing one, she climbed onto the table and calmly sat crosslegged. She took a deep breath.

"I struggle with myself quite a bit. I come from the middle class and I have to credit that with everything that I am today. My interest in social justice, economic justice and of course, environmental justice. And it's all connected. The thing is, I know that any successful movement must be accepted and embraced by the middle class. Look at the labor movement and the civil rights movement. On the other hand, environmentalism is successful and embraced by the middle class. But it's stagnating. It's not going anywhwere because huge corporations are still too powerful. How do we make the corporations understand that we are serious? That we are powerful, too?"

"I know where you're going. You think that if you blow up a couple of buildings, you'll prove a point. But the big corporations have access to the media, and the media has access to the middle class - to the people. They'll be on the side of the businesses, because the businesses provide jobs."

"Are you playing devil's advocate on purpose?" asked Lari.

"Yes," said Louis intently, "and because this is where action begins, with discussion."

Lari was quiet for awhile. "Maybe I should go read for awhile. I think I need some inspiration."

"You're on the right track though. Sabotage does work, when used correctly. Look, a few of us are meeting here tonight, after the worker bees have gone home. Stick around, OK?" He looked deeply into her eyes and put his hand on hers softly.

The pressure of his closeness was too much. She leaned forward and kissed him passionately. "Just a minute," he said, and quickly locked the door. Lari swept the books and papers off the table and quickly removed her clothes. Louis did the same. They fucked there on the table, wordlessly. For Lari, it was purely to relieve stress. Only later would she realize it was a way to gain trust from Louis, and enter the inner circle of the group.

When they were done, he produced two cold bottles of beer from the mini fridge beneath the table. They lay on the table, naked, drinking beer, lethargic. Slowly, Lari rolled to her side, and randomly picked up a book. She opened it up and started reading it. Just then...
13222111.title: Gaining Trust

132221112.content:
Hurriedly, the new lovers found their clothes and put them on. "Hey, anyone in there? You climb out the window again, Louis?" asked a female voice.

Louis opened the door. In stepped a plain woman with wire rimmed glasses, baggy clothes, and long straight blonde hair. She carried several books and papers. Lari dug through her purse, looking for something to comb her messed up hair with.

"What's up Karen?" asked Louis.

Rolling her eyes, Karen said, "Am I disturbing you?"

"No, we're done fucking for now, Karen. My name's Lari." She walked over and held out her hand. Karen looked at it a moment, and then walked over to Louis.

"The, um, thing we talked about is almost ready," whispered Karen.

"What are you going to do, burn down a few more suburban houses, only to see them get rebuilt a few months later with insurance money?" asked Lari. "Here's what I'd like to see - assassination. It's effective, it gets attention, it proves we're serious."

"It proves we're murderers with no respect for human life!" exploded Karen, then turning to Louis she said, "Where'd you get this CIA agent, or FBI fuck, or whatever the hell she is?"

Louis smiled, "Nobody would have sex with me as part of their job. I'm not that good. Lari," he said, suddenly getting serious, "Who the hell would want to risk getting the chair for our cause, when non-violent methods are just as effective. And who would we take down?

Lari sat down and looked out the window. "I'd do it. I don't have much time left anyway. And who wouldn't want to put a bullet in the head of..."
132221112.title: How about this?
